Package managers

Class ViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • managers.ViewManager
  • public class ViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The central controller of the application. Manages what the user can see and communicates with other managers in the background.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.lang.Boolean exit
      False by default, set to true if the user chooses to close the application
      private static java.lang.Boolean validExit
      False by default, set to true after user chooses a valid option at the end of the application otherwise they are prompted to try again

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ViewManager()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private static void exitSorter()
      Prompt the user to select an option which will either exit the application or run it again, where the user can select new parameters.
      static void isExit​(int userInput)
      Check if the user has selected a valid exit option.
      private static void randomiseArray()
      Randomise the array via Array Manager.
      private static void selectMaximumValue()
      User is prompted to enter a number which will be the maximum value of a randomly generated integer.
      private static void selectNumberOfValues()
      User is prompted to enter a number which will be the length of the array.
      private static void selectParameters()
      Call methods which each handle user input to set parameters of the random array to be generated
      private static void selectSorter()
      User is prompted to choose a sorting method via numbered list.
      private static void showSortedArray()
      Display the sorted array and how long it took to sort.
      private static void showSorterSelection()
      Show all available sorter methods.
      private static void showUnsortedArray()
      Display the unsorted array and wait for the user to press a key before sorting the array.
      static void startSorter()
      Call private methods which call public methods from public classes to set parameters of a random array, choose the method it will be sorted by, see the results and how long it took to achieve the result.

      Welcome message

    • Field Detail

      • exit

        private static java.lang.Boolean exit
        False by default, set to true if the user chooses to close the application

      • validExit

        private static java.lang.Boolean validExit
        False by default, set to true after user chooses a valid option at the end of the application otherwise they are prompted to try again

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewManager

        public ViewManager()

    • Method Detail

      • startSorter

        public static void startSorter()
        Call private methods which call public methods from public classes to set parameters of a random array, choose the method it will be sorted by, see the results and how long it took to achieve the result. The user can then decide if they want to run the application again with new parameters or close it

      • welcomeMessage

        private static void welcomeMessage()
        Welcome message

      • showSorterSelection

        private static void showSorterSelection()
        Show all available sorter methods.

      • selectSorter

        private static void selectSorter()
        User is prompted to choose a sorting method via numbered list. If a valid selection is made, the sorter is selected and a new instance of it is created by SortManager, otherwise the user is prompted to try again

      • selectParameters

        private static void selectParameters()
        Call methods which each handle user input to set parameters of the random array to be generated

      • selectNumberOfValues

        private static void selectNumberOfValues()
        User is prompted to enter a number which will be the length of the array. The array can have a length 2 - 10,000 integers, if the user selects a number outside of these bounds they will be prompted to try again.

      • selectMaximumValue

        private static void selectMaximumValue()
        User is prompted to enter a number which will be the maximum value of a randomly generated integer. An integer can have a value 2 - 10,000. If the user selects a number outside of these bounds they will be prompted to try again.

      • randomiseArray

        private static void randomiseArray()
        Randomise the array via Array Manager. This method purely improves readability of startSorter().

      • showUnsortedArray

        private static void showUnsortedArray()
        Display the unsorted array and wait for the user to press a key before sorting the array.

      • showSortedArray

        private static void showSortedArray()
        Display the sorted array and how long it took to sort.

      • exitSorter

        private static void exitSorter()
        Prompt the user to select an option which will either exit the application or run it again, where the user can select new parameters. If the user doesn't select a valid option they will be prompted to try again.

      • isExit

        public static void isExit​(int userInput)
                   throws InvalidExitSelectionException
        Check if the user has selected a valid exit option.
        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner reads the next integer input by the user.
        Throws:
        InvalidExitSelectionException - Thrown if the user doesn't choose 1 or 2.
